reviewText: I like these kind of films because weather, nature, etc. fascinate me.
My seven yr old who LOVES science loves this.
Good primer for kids. My 5 year old Grandson loves everything having to do with weather. Every kid should see this.

this was an enjoyable movie about how mother nature is at times...it is truly amazing to watch some of the things that happen like tornados...earthquakes...volcanoes erupting...it is a good show to watch...i like the nature shows..

How quickly the idyllic river scene can turn into a nightmare.  This documentary emphasizes the fact that Nature is not easy to deal with but her rampages somehow seem to bring out the best in humanity.
I tried to download this film, but I never could get the sound track to download with it.  It isn't much without sound
Extreme weather etc is really fascinating to me, as is knowing how to be prepared for what Nature can dish out.
Filmed in the 90's, the technology and footage are out of date.

An interesting look at natural disasters, including tornadoes, avalanches, earthquakes, wildfire and floods. Some of the re-inactments were a bit hokey and some of the footage wasn't as high quality as I would have liked, but overall the quality was high enough to be very interesting. The program includes some great interviews and interesting information we didn't know before. And a lot of the footage is fabulous.

It is a bit long for young viewers. I broke it up into two viewings for my twin 7-year-old sons, who loved it and couldn't wait to watch the second half the following night.
Decent show, got for my 5 year old who is into tornados and noticed it was no different than shows on cable.
Very boring and has an 80's feel to the video, which is odd since it's from 2009.
I have learned a lot from this movie. I give it 5 stars.
It can keep you on the edge of your seat,  Wild nature.
